{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3498926,"name":"Cole Shumaker","username":"c.shu","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/c.shu/{size}/136963_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T14:50:45.488Z","cooked":"

The purpose of the hinges would be to get it around the frame of the robot easier so we can put them on easier. Once the bumpers are fixed to the robot they would not be able to move in any direction.

Picture a C shape that can open up ~15 degrees on each leg.

I’m not an inspector, so I’m not sure about using hinges at all. But R409 shouldn’t apply if the BUMPERS don’t move after being attached to the ROBOT.

Although I’ve never seen this, I cannot believe it hasn’t been tried before.

@Al_Skierkiewicz @ChuckDickerson - any prior history on this type of bumper mod?

It is legal and my team has done it multiple times. Once the bumper is fixed in position the hinge is fully constrained and will not allow the bumper to articulate.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T17:53:38.659Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":361,"readers_count":360,"score":172.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484609,"topic_slug":"can-i-put-hinges-in-the-corner-of-my-bumpers","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11148,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-i-put-hinges-in-the-corner-of-my-bumpers/484609/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499205,"name":"Al Skierkiewicz Learn Something New, Every Day!","username":"Al_Skierkiewicz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/al_skierkiewicz/{size}/110877_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T19:59:40.683Z","cooked":"

This is common way for mounting bumpers. A team only needs to pull the pins out of the hinge to remove the system from the robot. I recommend other locking devices but this does work OK. McMaster has all kinds of locking devices, depending on price and robot design.

The bumper rules are completely different this year. It really dangerous to apply past rules to this years bumpers. LRIs are going to earn their pay just on bumper inspections this year.

We are working on a four foot tall bumper.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T20:07:32.747Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":281,"readers_count":280,"score":116.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484609,"topic_slug":"can-i-put-hinges-in-the-corner-of-my-bumpers","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":11148,"username":"anon91718515","name":null,"avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/can-i-put-hinges-in-the-corner-of-my-bumpers/484609/8","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499233,"name":null,"username":"anon91718515","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T20:20:06.814Z","cooked":"

Frank, please believe me when I say that there are very few people in the world who have read the new bumper rules more thoroughly than I.

The intent of the new rules is to:

  • make it easier for teams to be in compliance,
  • make it easier for inspectors to treat bumpers the same way they have treated the rest of the robot for many years,
  • allow bumpers to be made more protective with new materials and methods (but you’re still allowed to build with the old materials and methods, with limited exceptions).

LRI’s and RI’s need to really be careful that they do not flip these intentions around, and introduce new and more stringent barriers to teams this year.

FrankJ:

We are working on a four foot tall bumper

Sounds awesome! My team is only doing nine inches.

anon91718515:

LRI’s and RI’s need to really be careful that they do not flip these intentions around, and introduce new and more stringent barriers to teams this year.

I’m really, really not sure I want to see either Al or Chuck angry.

I have a feeling that an LRI or RI making it more difficult on teams over their bumpers will have that result. Don’t ask me why I get that impression.

I agree with. But did you refered to something being legal under past years which is a particular bad assumption for this year. But you know that

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T21:04:03.311Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484609,"topic_slug":"can-i-put-hinges-in-the-corner-of-my-bumpers","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":11148,"username":"anon91718515","name":null,"avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/can-i-put-hinges-in-the-corner-of-my-bumpers/484609/14","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499298,"name":null,"username":"anon91718515","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T21:18:28.413Z","cooked":"

The easy way to know if what you did last year is legal this year or not:

  • did you bend the noodles around the corner, and in so doing compress the foam? This is now illegal.
  • did you make separate sections of bumper, with each section having a mitered corner? This is now illegal.
  • everything else you did in the past continues to be legal.
  • there are lots of additional new legal options, which you should read about carefully.

Screenshot_20250201_141805_Drive1049×1144 113 KB

Yeah Gary, not sure if you meant “of course that is legal” or “of course that is illegal”. Under the new rules teams can make bumpers taller (but not shorter) than in the past. Yes, a four foot tall bumper would be legal this year.

The one sticky point would be if the bumpers are part of the robot for starting configuration? Sometimes bumpers are defined as part of the robot and sometimes they are not.

Regardless a three foot tall bumper would be legal provided the rest of the robot rules are met.

My LRI had white hairs before I met him so I am not taking the blame for that.

anon91718515:

Yes, a four foot tall bumper would be legal this year.

R104 says the robot cannot be taller than 3’ 6" in the STARTING CONFIGURATION.
